result.execSummary:
The defendant Genice I Muth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/2016 or penalty of 7 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Genice I Muth in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Hoff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

FINE: $542.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 7 days in Huber
Received August 11, 2016, from Alliance Counseling Center
Sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
